The correct answer to the question "How does identity resolution select attributes for unified individuals when there is conflicting information in the data model?" is:
A. Leverages reconciliation rules
Reconciliation rules are used to determine which value to select when there are conflicting pieces of information in the data model. These rules specify how to select a single value to save to a unified field that can’t have multiple values, such as an individual’s name, during the identity resolution process.

Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) is configuring an identity resolution ruleset based on Fuzzy Name and Normalized Email. To ensure the best email address is activated, NTO should:
A. Use the source priority order in activations to make sure a contact point from the desired source is delivered to the activation target.
This approach ensures that the email address from the most trusted and prioritized source is selected for activation, aligning with the principles of source priority in identity resolution. This method is particularly effective in scenarios where multiple sources provide email addresses, and a clear hierarchy is needed to determine the best contact point for activation.
